page.title: 04THE WATER MEADOWS
page.content: Down along the{River Stort}to the south of{Twyford Lock}there is a water meadow on the west bank that is a haven for wild life. It is part of the water overflow system. It has a great population of{birds, {butterflies,fish, rodents and plants. {Sedge warblers}are abundant.A family of{kingfishers}lives there.{Frogs, {toads and amphibians}are quite common. It is beautiful in the early morning.There are many{insects. {Emperor dragonflies}and dainty{ {damselflies}can be found there.{Marsh {Marigolds}and{tall bullrushes}are a big feature.All sorts of{fish}may be found,{pike,gudgeon,perch, {tench,rarely carp and bream.} When the river uses its overflow system the water meadows get completely drenched and flooded. { }
